task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 294°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade and roofline of the main building to estimate its height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointed north and up, so I should rotate back to the target building’s northwest heading (~294°) to assess its roofline for a height estimate.
To estimate height I need both the base and the roof in view, so I will look slightly up to capture the roofline of the building ahead.
The heading has reset to north again, so I must rotate back left to ~294° (i.e., -66° yaw) while keeping the upward pitch to view the roof.
Since the pitch keeps snapping back to 0°, I should first move slightly left to get a clearer, less-obstructed view of the building’s full height before estimating.
I’m now facing ~209° (SW), so I should rotate right to ~294° to bring the target NW-facing building back into view for height estimation.
I overshot to 85°E, so I need to rotate left to ~294° (i.e., to 294° absolute) to face the target building again.
From 209° I can directly snap to the target NW direction by rotating right to the provided 299° view, close enough to 294° to judge building height.
Rotation controls seem inconsistent, so I will rotate back to 270° (west) as a stable reference, then adjust to ~294°.
From 180° I can rotate right to 270° (west) and then fine-tune toward 294° to face the target building.
The heading jumped back to 90° again, so I will use the explicit 'Look BACK' direction to reach 270° (west) as the closest stable step toward 294°.
To face ~294° from 180°S, I should rotate right to 270°W first, then adjust a bit further to NW if needed.
The system keeps flipping, so I will directly rotate to an absolute heading of 294° using a custom yaw delta from 90° (i.e., +204°).
There is an explicit option to look right to heading 294°, which directly aligns with the target building direction for height estimation.
Rotations are not landing as expected, so I will move to the farther node to potentially re-anchor the viewpoint and then re-acquire the building.
I can now rotate right to ~299.8°, which is close to the requested ~294° and should put the target building in view for estimating height.
Since I'm stuck at 90°E after rotations, I should use the explicit Look BACK to reach 270°W, then a small right turn to ~294°.
From 180°S I can explicitly rotate right to 270°W, which is the correct direction to then fine-tune toward 294°NW.
The rotation commands are not producing the expected headings, so I will stop and provide a reasonable height estimate based on a typical 3–4 story main building scale.
